question.title: In Jetty 12.x how to make logging of a webapp independent of logging of Jetty
question.body:
With Jetty 9.x I was able to have separated logging config for my webapp and Jetty.

I've migrated to Jetty 12.0.22, and now Jetty uses slf4j.

My app used to use logback-classic through slf4j, but it is now forced to use the same slf4j implementation that Jetty uses.

How to make logging config in both environments independent from the other one?

Previously, I didn't have any issue, because Jetty didn't use slf4j, and did not interfere with my use of logback.

I've tried to use logback-classic for both jetty and my webapp, but I have some custom appenders and formatters that lie in my webapp code.

Related doc:

  • Official Jetty doc.
  • Issue opened to the Jetty team.

answers.body:
I had this previously:

WebAppContext ctx = new WebAppContext("myWebapp", "/");
ctx.setParentLoaderPriority(true);

I have changed it into:

ctx.setParentLoaderPriority(false);

and now my webapp classpath has priority over Jetty, and I can use logback.

question_comments.body: Perhaps you should add more details about your previous logging config.
